caption: Delicious thai food! We had spicy basil chicken fried rice and southern fried chicken served with Jasmine rice. Both the dishes had beautiful flavors and we absolutely loved the taste. The portion size was not sufficient compared to the price but overall experience was great!
Best Thai I've had so far in brooklyn. Had drunken noodles, snapper, Thai fried rice and green curry. The curry was exceptionally delicious. Will be returning.
This place provides excellent service as well as yummy food. One of the best spot in the area. The food arrived quickly and the rates are fair. I recommend this place.
The best khao soi in all of NY 🤩🤩
I highly recommend this Thai restaurant fantastic customer service great staff clean restaurant I recommend anyone who loves Thai food check them out won’t be disappointed thank you .
I really love Pad Prik king which is fresh and yummy.

The food here is excellent and authentic. Can vouch for the curries, drunken noodles, spring rolls, pad Thai, curry puffs, several stir fries, mango sticky rice. I’ve spent ~ 6 weeks in Thailand over the last few years and this is the first restaurant I’ve tried in the states that reminds me of the food there. The curries especially, take us back to Chiang mai. Uni will hold us over til next vacation. Delivery is fast, prices are reasonable.

Delicious! I got Tom Kha soup, Pineapple fried rice, Thai fried rice, Lemon Thai iced tea and Lava cake. So yummy and fresh! I came in to place an order. It was ready shortly, and they are so friendly! Highly recommend to try!  Only soy sauce was missing. It would be nice to have it as an add-on!
Affordable prices and friendly service. Noodles in pad see ew are soft and taste very fresh. Looking forward to trying more dishes here.

Highly recommend the khao soi and the pad kee mao (drunken noodles). I'd say the khao soi is my favorite that I've had in the city. For those doing takeout and are worried about soggy khao soi, Uni Thai packages all of the ingredients separately so you can assemble when you're ready for it -  how thoughtful! The staff here are also super friendly and prompt. As of late September, there were some issue with their phone lines that they were working through, so please be patient & try to order in-person, through their website, or on one of the food apps if you can.

Last week was the first time we came to that place. But It is absolutely not the last. We had a good time with the good service, with the superb cooking and booze and with the comfortable payment. We will surely return there soon.

I really love their food and delivery gets fast, and food is fresh. The only thing I would improve is the radio of delivery, due to this I am forced to order from UBER EATS but my house is literally 1 block outside of their perimeter and when I call to explain this, they were not very flexible, the SE area of the perimeter is even further than just crossing that 1 block cuz I live closer to them. Noodles are great! <3

I really wanted to give it 2.5 stars but 3 stars for the good service! The dumplings dough was undercooked but the filling was decent. The chicken was so dry in my drunken noodles and the garlic noodles were tasteless with barely any sauce. The basil fried rice was decent and if you’re ordering I’d recommend that. If you’re used to going to decent/good thai spots in the city, this will be subpar to you most likely.
cute and delicious

FANTASTIC AUTHENTIC Thai food.  Randomly discovered this place trying to find a restaurant with outdoor seating and was blown away.  Thai owned business, with food that tastes like authentic Thai home cooking. Fresh ingredients make a huge difference over the typical non-Thai owned restaurants in Brooklyn. No longer need to hike to Queens to get real Thai food. This is the best in Brooklyn by far and I'd say better than anything I've had elsewhere in the city too. Look forward to returning to try everything else on the menu!

I've always passed by this place and finally tried it. The food is made fast and is high quality. The pineapple fried rice was delicious. The staff is also very friendly. I definitely will be coming back here.
This place is amazing
My new favorite Thai place! I've had Drunken Noodles, Khao Soi, and Pad See Euw - all amazing! Food is ready very fast, and the staff super friendly - they always remember me!
Ordered pickup and food was great! one of the best Khao Soi I have had in the city!!
Great food. Kind people. Everything you could ask for in neighborhood restaurant
Full of flavor and delicious! A welcomed gem in the neighborhood. Can't stop thinking about it and will order again soon!
Absolutely love this new spot in the neighborhood! Incredibly delicious food. MUCH more flavorful than other local thai places. Highly recommend!
I ordered for pick up and the food was great. Very fresh, competitive pricing, and overall I will order again soon.

This cute new place does indeed serve up Bangkok street cart style Thai food. I lived in Bangkok for a year, so I can attest to this.  We had a pineapple friend rice, masaman curry and pad Thai. All had a great flavor and fresh ingredients. Also had an shrimp satay appetizer—amazing sauce!  The owner , “Brook” showed me his life story, drawn as a comic on the wall by the register. I’m pretty sure it was his mom or other elder relative cooking in the back. Very sweet.  Comfortingly for a small place, it seems built for social distancing, with no seats and most of the small space given to the kitchen.  We will definitely be ordering from them again for pick up. Not sure if they have delivery yet.
This is my favorite dessert that can be brought me into the sweet world.
